column5: sparśayajña m. ein in der blassen Berührung
column6: sparśayajña m. ein in der blossen Berührung
column7: Typo "a" should be replaced by "o", "blossen" is correct

column5: (said of the gods) to be pleased with, like, accept favourably (as sacrifices, prayers or hymns), RV., (chiefly said of kings or princes)
column6: After "RV." it should by a semicolon instead of comma, so "(chiefly said of kings or princes)" should be placed with the next line "to guard, defend, ..."

column7: Links to Whitney Roots and Westergaard Dhatupatha do not link anywhere
Typo. There is some printing artefact after म in the scanned page. I do not think it represents र् and आ.

Typo. Instead of the third letter of the third class, the fifth nasalised letter of the first class of vargeeya vyanjan has been written due to only slight difference in the glyphs representing them. This mistake is found repeated in the entries following it. It can be confirmed by viewing the scanned pages.

in the fifth case. It should be the fourth case. Is सम्बोधन being considered as a separate case to get this as the fifth case? Not clear. It is not a typo as it matches what we find in the scanned print.

Typo, this mistake is present in at least 10 places (1 uktha (poëme) LB 2 ṛtu (poëme) LB 3 kāvya (poëme) LB 4 kṛti (poëme) LB 5 gīta (poëme) LB 6 gai (poëme) LB 7 divya (poëme) LB 8 purā (poëme) LB 9 prakara (poëme) LB 10 rāma (poëme))
Typo. In the etymology, जन्मन् has been entered correctly. However, for the headword, due to the print being slightly unclear, त् has been entered insted of न्.

Typo. This an error present in print. I'm aware that the maintainers policy is to digitise the contents as it is, even if errors are found. So, just tagging this error, in case it may be useful in the future.

column5: wrong headword. a more general problem: entries with d̤ (d with two dots below = ड़) are cut so od̤iya is only o.

column6: The source indexed here is attributed to BHAṬṬĀCĀRYA, J. V. here:  LB https://www.sanskrit-lexicon.uni-koeln.de/scans/SHSScan/2020/web/index.php LB But the book appears to be written by someone else: Vidyasagara, Pandit-Kulapati Jibananda LB https://www.sanskrit-lexicon.uni-koeln.de/scans/csldev/csldoc/build/dictionaries/prefaces/shspref/shspref01.html  LB
column7: Incorrect bibliography entry for the source
